title: Tiny Pieces!
text:
My kids adore Lalaloopsy! They were thrilled to get this treehouse. It is cute and fun.

The pieces are tiny. Not just the dolls, which are much smaller than I would have anticipated, but there are little accessories that are so tiny. It'd be difficult for an adult to play with these tiny accessories. The small pieces ended up discarded by the kids almost immediately. They were just frustrated by them, not being able to use them for much of anything.

The doll figures themselves are small. Much smaller than I anticipated. They are also not the best quality. The details are a bit sloppy on them, which isn't something I expected from Lalaloopsy. The kids like the dolls.

The treehouse itself is a nightmare. If you manage to get it out of its packaging without breaking it, you then get to refer to a diagram to try to set the thing up. Tiny ropes to make tiny zip lines. Tiny swings with tiny attachments. It took me a good 15 minutes to get everything set up like it showed in the diagram. Then one of the kids touches it. Then they beg me to reset up what they just messed up. And on and on it goes. Me resetting the thing up every 5 minutes, because they certainly can't do it. After a day or so, they forgot the zipline was there, forgot about the pulleys, overlooked the swings, and just played with the dolls around the treehouse, not in the treehouse.

This is a very frustrating toy. It is too small, too fragile, and too complicated for kids to actually enjoy. I can't see any kid under the age of 12 begin able to appropriately work this toy. Any kid able to use it is probably too old to enjoy it.

title: So CUTE!
text: My four year old son adores these Beanie Boos. He thinks they are the cutest thing he has ever seen. And really, I must agree. They are the perfect size for kids. But a warning- they'll want them all! Slush is his favorite of the Beanie Boos. He is cute and super soft. He is small enough to be a stocking stuffer or take along toy, but big enough to not be a miniature toy that ends up lost.

title: She Loves It!
text: My five year old daughter is a bookworm and has had her eye on a unicorn Pillow Pet for quite some time. This seemed like the perfect combination for her. The Pillow Pet is the full-size version. I was a little wary of the book. Most product placement books are pretty lacking in story quality. I was actually surprised that the book wasn't that bad. It is 32 pages long and hardback. The pictures are a bit odd, since all the characters are Pillow Pets. But overall, the book is a nice touch to go with the Pillow Pet. The book will win no awards, but it is a cute story that kids will love. My daughter loves them both!

title: Roar!
text: My 4 year old loves his Dragon Happy Napper! Ring the doorbell of the castle and hear the dragon roar! I wish the dragon would roar when he is his dragon self. My son has figured out how to hit the back just right to make the dragon roar. You wouldn't think there would be any educational value in a Happy Napper, but my son had to figure out how to flip him back and forth, which is a real test of a 4 year old's motor skills. This dragon is cute and well made.

title: Ballerina for A Ballerina
text:
Tippy Tumbelina is so very cute. My kids love her. I love how well made Lalaloopsy dolls are. I also love that their hair is plastic, so you don't have crazy doll hair to deal with. Really, my only complaint with Tippy is her shoes. They are so difficult to get on and so easy to get off. I wish her ballet slippers were made onto her like her hair. It'd make my life a lot easier. We've had Tippy for quite some time and she's been drug all over the place with us. With the wipe of a damp cloth she looks brand new!

I was concerned with Lalaloopsy doll's eyes being buttons. I couldn't imagine that being a good idea. But they are made onto her face, no chance of coming off at all. It is made to look like buttons are sewn on her eyes, but they are part of her molded plastic head.

title: Arrg! Me Cutey!
text:
My 2 year old son got Patch for his 2nd birthday. He loves him. My 5 year old daughter is a big Lalaloopsy fan, so she is always waiting in the wings for the 2 year old to drop him. His parrot does look a little more like a crazy chicken of some sort. My only wish is that Patch's eyepatch was permanent. It comes off. So our patch has been patchless since about 2 hours after he was opened. I also LOVE that Patch has permanent whitie tighties on under his clothes. Helpful for a 2 year old to have toys that have on big boy underwear for potty training purposes. I know this toy is supposed to be for older kids, but it really is a great doll, even for a 2 year old. The shoes and patch are really the only small parts, and you can easily take those things off.

I just wish they made more boy Lalaloopsy dolls. It is hard to find dolls for boys. This is a great doll for a boy! (Or a girl!)

title: GI Joe
text: I am impressed. This GI Joe is extremely well made. He can stand up to the rough play that kids put him through. Within minutes of being out of the box, my kids were throwing him off the porch to see how far her could parachute. They were very entertained. I did not have GI Joes as a kid, so I can't really compare them to the original. There are a lot of small parts, so they aren't kidding on the 5 and up age thing. (Although, my 4 year old is okay with him, but he is pretty mature with toys and isn't a chewer.) He has a flashlight, pistol, rifle, knife, belt, holster, goggles, backpack, other random baggage (I'm not hip on the army terms for such things), helmet, and boots- that all come off. Some of the parts are too small for the kids to work themselves (particularly hooking the knife onto the belt). Their kid fingers just can't seem to work those tiny buttons and clips. It is hard for me to do it! (I seriously thought we were going to have to break out the tweezers for that blasted knife.) Despite that, they love GI Joe. He is extremely well built and very detailed.

title: Our Dolls Heads Are Falling Off!!!
text:
My two oldest were thrilled to get Makayla! (5 year old girl, 4 year old boy) They loved her, for a day or so. She doesn't come with too many small parts, just the shoes, really, are small enough to be of concern.
Immediately out of the box, her head popped off. She has a huge head for her body (which is cute) but it makes it easy for her head to pop off. (It easily pops back on.) If the kids fight over her, her head pops off. It is easy enough to put back on that they don't need my help with it, but I foresee a day when we have a head with no body or a body with no head floating around the toy box.
I loaded the CribLife.com website up. They were minutely interested in the website. You can create your own room and pick your doll. It really seemed like more of a marketing strategy to get you to buy more of the dolls, because it shows all the dolls and prompts you to "get to know them" which translated into the kids pouring over the computer to determine which one they wanted next. Once that was determined (the result- all of them), they went on about their business and wanted nothing more from the website. I tried to see if they were interested in creating a room for Makayla, but they wanted to create a place in their room for Makayla. They weren't too interested in the virtual aspect of the toy.
I also wanted to add that she is pretty small. I thought she'd be regular Baby Alive size, but she isn't. Her head is the size of a softball and her body is tiny compared to that. It is almost a mini-doll, though slightly larger than most of the mini-dolls on the market.

title: They Love Her!
text: My 5 year old daughter and 3.5 year old son love Pinkie Pie! This Pinkie Pie Newborn "learns" to walk (she moves her legs and looks like she is walking when the kids hold her hands while her legs are moving). She has a paci, bottle, and bowl of food. She is slightly bigger than our Sweetie Bell Newborn Pony. Her hair is a bit different from the other My Little Pony toys we have. She has this very fuzzy hair and not the silky pony hair of the others. We did finally figure out how to turn her off so the kids could sleep with her. The kids like her just as much as their other Newborn My Little Pony. The walking feature doesn't seem to be an added bonus to them, it just is.

title: A Decent Resource
text: My children love the LeapFrog Tag reading system. I am not the biggest fan. However, the LeapFrog phonics set is less of the "fun" stuff from other Leapfrog books (the sound effects, popular characters, etc.) and more actual reading practice. While this set of books is a decent resource for teaching young children to read, it isn't the best. First, the whole premise of the Tag system is a bit flawed. The kids learn to love the electronic ability of the Tag, not the book itself. They rely on the pen to bring the book to life, not their imaginations. So, it is a bit of a slippery slope with the Tag system. My children use the Tag for fun in their play time, but reading lessons do not include use of the Tag. The Phonics Books are a decent resource to have, and they do love the books. If you are trying to teach your child to read, this is probably not for you. If you are looking for something fun that will supplement their learning, this is a decent resource for you.

title: Liar, Liar, Pants on Fire!
text: [[VIDEOID:f34df57801577a5b053e814f91b51e04]] Nothing in the ad about this doll is true, except perhaps the length of the doll. There is no 'Click n' Play. It does not sit up at all, even when propped up against something, because the filling forces it to bounce flat. I was going to set it on the edge of my hospital bed table, after I drew 'clean me here' on certain areas (for the CNA's that don't do their job properly), but it will not sit. It should have been made fully of plastic, as it appears to be. Instead, just the lower legs, feet, lower arms, hands and head are plastic. Also, as you can see in my video clip, the pacifier is far too big for the baby's mouth, and also looks vaguely pornographic...smh...Would you want YOUR little girl getting an early education from this toy? Save your money, and go get a doll at Dollar General, where this doll undoubtably came from 😠

title: BEST play food ever!
text: So why did they not make them like this when I was a child? :) I love these. I purchased them for my two-year-old and so does she. They are all about the same size so they are not true to size. However, they do offer many different games and activities for preschool age children. I have been working in preschools for years and have studied early childhood education; this set is durable, colorful, and I recommend these for anyone looking for a nice play food set.

title: 14 yr ol grandson loved it
text:
I gave this to my teenage grandson for a Christmas eve present an he just loved it. Went to his room and started working on it right away. (this is really saying something bc we can't get him off his PS4 ) He worked on it until he put it all together.
He brings it up to me and said... can I have another one? lol
I recommend this to anyone who likes leggos.
To my surprise leggos even have kits for adults!

title: Collecting Son Loved It
text: My son is a collector of all things like this and he was very happy to get this one.  It is small, soft, and cute.  My son who knows of these things says it is worthy of five stars.

title: Great, Easy to Learn Game
text:
I had never heard about the Tiny Epic game series, but after playing this game, our oldest has put other Tiny Epics on his wish list. I love games that are easy to learn and hard to master and this little resource allocation game is great for both of those with a little of dice based luck thrown in. I think the concept is great, and who doesn't love a game full of cute little pieces. The card art and the meeple designs are both very good and well made. The whole package makes it great for a travel game, although the little pieces makes it a little dangerous.

Game play was pretty quick and we played a couple games, one to learn and the other more seriously, and everyone thought it was a decent game. I think it will be pulled out a number of times in the future.

title: Great Game Piece Design, Play Good but at Times Frustrated
text:
I have to say that the game board design was brilliant. I loved the way it unfolds although sometimes it took a bit to figure out how and when it should unfold. The reveal is fantastic and well thought out. The games were good but occasionally frustrating. I feel like we used far more clues than usual and at one point we used all and still could not get past it. We eventually suspected a misprint and figured a way around it. (I was out of the room when they did.)

We love escape room games and I think we all agreed that this one had one of the best game boards, but we all thought it was more confusing than average. We completed it in a couple evenings of 90 minutes or so game play.

title: Unique Game for Us, Was Fun
text:
We have never played a legacy game like this before. I like that the rules are pretty easy and it works a little like tetris as you try to cover space and penalty areas with rocks while protecting bonus areas with trees. It is a nice little exercise in spatial relations and simple long term strategy. We actually restarted once a couple of us had epiphanies about what they should have done. But the kind of cool thing is that as you go on and build on what you know and have played, your open new rules and get new pieces introduced that again challenges your placing skills. I found it to be a unique game. We played it with four people ages 13-50s and it played well for those ages, but might not be good for the under 10 crowd. Also, the game took a few evenings, so you need to be able to put the game aside and have the same players available to pick it up again.

The game pieces are nice and I love the enveloped stages. It is a well made game and a good idea. Simple to play, but with enough mental challenge to get you thinking a little. Love it for its uniqueness and I think we will be able to play through it again a couple times.

title: Great Game of Deceit
text: First I have to confess, I thought this was an escape room game when it arrived and we held off on playing it.  When we opened it, it became apparent how wrong were were.  This turned out to be a fun and easy to learn game that is very much like the Among Us video game.  The cards quickly identify your role and if you are a robber, you need to sneak the jewels out stealthily while others have eyes covered.  There were some occurances of peeking though.  It is a fun and quick to learn game good for four or more people.

title: Intimidated Everyone, Confused Many, Thrilled Few
text:
I literally had to force my family to play this game because they were completely intimidated by the details of this game. I eventually got four of us together and we started slogging through the rule books and it seemed like a lot of it was just coming to a consensus on what we just read meant. Which also did not inspire people into thinking they were enjoying the game. The flicking was kind of fun, and connection to drawing was interesting concept, but flicking seemed kind of random and no one was able to incorporate it into a strategy. We stumbled through a round and scoring and I fear that the game will not come back out of the closet. Perhaps we will try it again, I'm really not sure why the family was so soured against this game.

***** updating *****

This game eventually found a champion in our oldest son who took it up and read the rules and requested that we try it with him. He found it kind of fascinating and I have to admit that with a more receptive group, it was better. I still found that there were a lot of kind of random happenings and you get random bonuses in other sections from the one you were starting on, but we have had a few strategy conversations and he is looking forward to plyaing it again. It is a bizarre game, but unique and it definitely struck a chord with my son. So I am bumping this review up to four stars.

title: Interesting Craft Toy Project
text: This was a unique little set up.  It's like high end, single use playdough.  The concept is very easy, choose a face and a place it in a mode, then fill the mode with a package of the magical compound that sets up to make the body.  The final product is a little slimy and more of a rubber that the squishy material we were expecting.  But the kids ended up having an hour's fun with this and a second set.  Not sure that it produces lifelong treasures, but it was worth the price for the time spent and some play.  Interesting concept.

title: Good Even if you Don't Know the Franchise
text: We got this for a family game night activity and found it challenging and fun.  We actually didn't complete the first game so we are going to bring in a couple new players and see if we can push through it with us holding back for the first challenges.  I believe I am the only person who has actually seen any great amount of the Walking Dead series and I got some extra fun out of details, but it worked perfectly well for those who have never seen the show.  These are great activities and I am glad to have this one.  Recommend to anyone who likes escape rooms.

title: Got This Way Too Late!!
text:
We have been playing and spreading Kubb to all our family and neighbors and we were intrigued to see a new variant of number Kubb. We only got one chance to play this between snow falls in Minnesota but it proved to be a fun game. We found a iphone app for scoring and ran three practice games before the sun went down and the snow returned... Totally looking forward to May when we can get outside again.

The game is easy to learn, easy to score (although I suggest an app) and fun to play. It is the perfect family gathering game, especially for those who already play kubb. This set has a nice solid tossing stick, but the numbered pins seem a little small. But this is the only set we have ever seen so we'll see. Highly recommend!

title: Great Collection of Vinyl Cling Snowflakes
text: These attach very well! (note they are one sided and you need to clean the windows first) We have had a number of their products and they have stayed through entire holiday seasons (again, after cleaning the windows.)  The look great, the kids love putting them up and occasionally move them.  They are a good size for filling both picture windows and the narrow windows beside the door.  Definitely make the season!

title: Easy to Learn, Great for all ages, Better in big group
text: I love games that are easy to learn and quick and fun to play.  This definitely meets those qualifications, but may not be vastly strategic.  It is basically a little rock, paper, scissors with a little prisoners dilemna.  The rounds are lightning fast as you can be called out for stealing or thrown out for false accusations.  Strange that you can go out on the first round of a game and have to watch a number of rounds until you can come back in.  It definitely plays better with more people. We played four and it was ok, five was better and the full 10 would probably be a lot better.  Love the garbage container box - it was immediately coveted for many other uses.  The cards are small and cute and of decent quality.  We will bring it out at future reunions as a kids ice breaker, but probably will not have a whole lot of replay in the house on game nights because it needs more people.

title: Good Quality Temporary Tattoos
text: These are super cute temporary tatoos.  They have great cartoon qualities and we plan on giving them out along with candy to trick or treaters this year.  We tried a couple and they applied well and lasted a couple days before looking too ragged to keep on.  They hold up as well as any of these temporary tattoos.

title: Great Cabin Puzzle
text: This is a wonderful image for the cabin or dreaming of being at the cabin. The pieces are high quality and standard square pieces that meet up on a standard grid.  No weird shaped pieces here.  They are thick and solid and were cut cleanly and go together cleanly.  A big surprise was getting a poster of the final puzzle so you don't have to pass around just the box top.  I wish all puzzles did this.  It was reasonably challenging for us for a 500 piece puzzle, taking up a evening that probably went a little too late.  Love this puzzle, recommend!

title: A Lot of Fun
text: We have brought this out a couple times, and I think it will have some staying power and be a regular part of our game rotation.  It is a great crossing of charades and pictionary.  The string is a little challenging and we actually handwashed it to make it a little more pliable. Otherwise it kept its shape a little too well.  In fact, due to issues with drawing with the string, it seems to lean a little toward charades.  Rules are super easy and good for scoring both the performer and the guessers and keeps everyone engaged in the game.  Some words are a little challenging, but I like the solution for randomizing word choice.  Anyone can learn this game in seconds and nearly all age ranges will work.  Great ice breaker game and gift.

title: Great New Set for HP Lovers
text: I got this kind of sight unseen and didn't know it was going to be Harry Potter until it arrived.  I hoped it would be Moaning Myrtle and I got my wish!  Looking at the included poster checklist, there are few others that I feel like I absolutely need, but as a set, they really fill in the Potter Lego world for the true fan of the franchise.  Lots of secondary characters and alternate dress for Harry, Hermione and Ron.  I guess there are a couple great ones, The Mandrake and the phoenix come up.  Those would both be great, but mostly it seems to fill in the smaller characters.  There are a few great pieces like books as well.  Great collection, but again, probably best appreciated by the hardcore fan.

title: Quaint and Classy
text: We are going to use this as decor in a time share rental.  It looks so classic with the wood and the metal, and everyone knows and can appreciate a quick vacation tic tac toe game.  It is not particularly big, but that works with the location it is going.  The wood looks great and vintage, the metal is a little less distressed and vintage looking and the connectors are not super strong, but the overall effect is great.  It looks great on the hearth and adds a nice playful and thoughtful touch.  Love it.

title: Simple to Learn, Fun Game
text:
This is the perfect camping game! Dice and a couple score cards and rules fit into our camping farkle cup and should work well our picnic blanket. And what better game to play on a camping trip, than a bear attack game! Actually, my partner does litigation for endangered carnivores and points out this game puts bears in a bad light, but it is just a game.

The game is very simple and can be picked up quickly by even young players. The action is fast and frantic. The scoring might be the hardest concept as the scoring can flip based on whether all bears are shot or if some survive. You dice might go from a winner to a loser or the opposite. That is also a nice surprise at the end of a round. Great game for a quick game, I can see this being a regular on our trips.

title: Great Themed Uno
text: This is a great themed Uno set.  It could be better for the hardcore fan as it pretty much sticks to the main characters and the "twist" themed rule is pretty mild.  I would have been happy to see some more obscure characters and a little more office based rule changes.  If you love the Office and UNO, this is the perfect marriage.

title: A Fun, Ridiculous Game
text: We were looking for some games to entertain some younger kids while still allowing adults to join in.  This fit the bill perfectly. The game is super simple, just find your challenge and then perform it with a pair of T Rex arms in the time limit.  Flip the timer and let the laughing begin.  It is actually just a silly, but entertaining game that anyone can figure out instantly.  Not sure that it would have much long term playability in a single family, but we probably will use it quite a bit when entertaining friends with younger kids.

title: Perfect Game for Family Gatherings
text:
I love games that are effortless to learn, but hard to master. This game is definitely that. The rules are super easy and the concepts are understood instantly, but the strategies in getting people into situations are only limited by your guile. We often play games at our family reunions and this would be absolutely perfect were it not for Covid. So our reunion is cancelled, but our immediate family dry run showed how perfect it will be. It is perfect for all ages from pre-teen to grandparent and has a nice rivalry.

The game parts itself are nice but not premium. To be honest, you could make the game up with just index cards, but it is nice to have nicely printed cards. This would be a fantastic gift, and those that can get together for Christmas are definitely playing a round of this!

title: Good Simple Game
text:
this game has all the feel of a game of checkers. Similarly, you are trying to advance mushrooms across a "checkered" board by sliding them roughly diagonally. Now the twists, eating replaces jumping, slugs replace kings, and a second board it superimposed on to the original so slugs and mushrooms only share half the available spaces. I love that it is easily learned and the instructions are short, the objective is clear. I love games that are easy to learn, more difficult to master. In this game, you try to force a mushroom through and at times sacrificing slugs to to it. The pieces are wonderful, the board is a little flimsy, but visually appealing.
A good two player game for get togethers. Not quite five stars, but a solid four star.

title: Cute, But Very Quick Project
text: I did this with my youngest son who has a thing for unicorns.  I would say that the project from unboxing to clean up was less than 15 minutes.  The instructions are graphical and set us back a little bit, but they ended up decipherable and complete.  I do recommend and adult dispense the glitter as it is kind of all over right now, and it is weird to mix a kind of thick glue and glitter paste.  applying glue and unicorn sihlouettes was quick.  We wet the unicorns so they would bend to the inside of the jars better.  Which leads us to the two hardest parts, pulling the plastic sheet insulator out of the lights so they work, and putting on the handle.  All mastered in a seconds, but kind of challenging.  In the end, the lanterns are actually pretty cute and one of the better end products we have gotten from one of these kits.

title: Nice Collection of Action Figures
text: My youngest is huge into Fortnite and collecting figures so I thought this would be perfect.  I remember Fortnite starting out with some really crappy branded products even though it lends itself so well to things like this.  Well they got it right and this collection has some quality action figures as well as a great assortment of accessories.  I don't personally recognize the players, but my kids all did and really liked the accessories as well. It is a great gift for a Fortnite fan, although I am told that these are older skins that may be dated.  I'm just happy that they liked them.

title: Interesting and Simple Game
text: I took one careful reading through the instructions and a few glimpses back to catch onto this game. It really is a simple strategy game for 3 to 6 players. Definitely no option for two, but it scales well to six.  There is a some real though put into the wolf science and politics of the game, including the chance of having a pack member killed for preying on livestock.  My partner is a wolf conservationist and was really hopeful that this might prove to be a thank you gift she could give to people she works with and for.  In the end, it was not the most addictive game, but it is very well constructed.  the cards and board are all solid cardboard and well designed.  It is definitely a more beautiful than playable, but play is ok.  My only criticism is that there are a lot of colors used that are not always super easy for those of us with color blindness. It took some really focus for me to set up the board and match dark brown and forest green wolves and match color coded dice.  Luckily there were other eyes to help.

title: Great, Fun Float
text: This is a little smaller than I would have guessed looking at the photos, but it is a fun design.  We have been keeping chickens for the last year, so this fits in great with our new chicken themed backyard.  It is still April in Minnesota so we haven't put the pool up yet, but it should be a feature through the summer.  We did get it out and fill it up out of curiosity and it is currently taking up a lot of cubic feet in the garage, waiting for June.  Very happy with it, it is big and fun.

title: OK Idea, But Didn't Quite Work
text:
Uno is a classic that has been reconfigured into a slew of new and novel ideas. This sounded like a great idea but we had a couple of issues with it. The biggest issue was that ties went almost 100% to one side which made us have to find a way to randomize who played on which side of the showdown piece. Something about the way the parts were beveled gave a very consistent bias for one side.

The second issue we had with it was that there were just too many showdown cards. It was hard to get rid of cards with all the showdown additions. In fact a couple games were just abandoned because there was not end in sight. To be honest, I don't think I can get our family to play this again.

title: Not My Favorite Melissa and Doug
text: We have and love a number of Melissa and Doug plushed animals and I have to say that I am a little underwhelmed with this one.  My partner is a wolf activist that does a lot of public presentations and booths and we were hoping and still planning to use this for tabletop decoration.  But the representation of a wolf is a little iffy. The ears seem small, the shape is a little stiff and not as good as others.  We also have their moose and it does make a great diorama in the kids room with the wolf looking up at the moose.  Still love the brand, but wish this one was a little better.

title: Great Line of Star Wars Legos Builds
text: I love the microfighter series and this one fits right in.  Love the minifigure and love the Y wing build, in fact it answers a question asked when leaving the movie, "Was she flying a Y wing?"  This is a quick build, 10-15 minutes max and results in a nice, study model.  We have been getting this line up for a while and they have all stayed together in a display. They are great builds for the SW fan and a great Lego line.  Very happy with this installment!

title: Fun Build
text: My kids loved the Venom mech suit and the shootable missiles in this set.  Personally, I'm on the fence of the Spidey jet build, but it is a fun set.  The boys took about 20 minutes to finish the kit and said this was a five star set. I would actually leave it at 4.5 because I really think the jet model is a little weak.  There are a number of unusual pieces in the set that will be treasured for rebuilds and I think that is where the model is headed for.  It's a pretty decent set, I just would have liked a bit strong model for the Jet.

title: Great Helicopter Set
text: We requested a reviewer set of this from Amazon Vine but got sent the wrong helicopter set. We got LEGO City Police Helicopter Chase 60244, which is a wonderfully unique set with a great Semi build and a working pull cord helicopter.  That is also a great and unique build.  We ended up getting this set locally so we could review it and we loved this one too.  There is a great variety of vehicles and mini figures.  It was a thirty minute build with some play during the build.  All the vehicles are solid and would stay together very well through interactive play.  They are a great addition to any lego city.  Great set!

title: Cute Build
text: Our two youngest have bought into the Trolls Lego line.  The oldest are too purist to build a set that has such huge pieces that form the house. They believe it is heresy to build a piece specifically for a set like this.  Those protests aside, This is a cute set and would be loved by anyone who loved the Trolls movie and I'm sure the new release will cause sales to be pretty good for these.  They seem to be very playable sets, recreating houses and vehicles.  Would be great for younger builders.

title: One of our favorite new Lego builds
text: These are fun little builds and fantastic displays.  We have three of them and they sit together on the eye level Lego display shelves.  I really think this is one of the most unique and fun builds they have come out with and my favorite of the Ninjago line up.  They looks great with a character behind the arcade screen.  It took about 20 minutes for my kids to put two of these together and they both gave them enthusiastic five star reviews.  Great job Lego!

title: One of my Favorite New Lego Builds
text: These are fun little builds and fantastic displays.  We have three of them and they sit together on the eye level Lego display shelves.  I really think this is one of the most unique and fun builds they have come out with and my favorite of the Ninjago line up.  They looks great with a character behind the arcade screen.  It took about 20 minutes for my kids to put two of these together and they both gave them enthusiastic five star reviews.  Great job Lego!

title: An Interesting Mech Suit Idea
text: The kids enjoyed making this kit.  It was quick, maybe 15 minutes and was taken apart almost as quickly and built into other things.  As a model, it did not seem to inspire the kids much, and I have to say that it didn't to much for me either.  There are some nice pieces and nice to have another spiderman mini figure, but I think this will be relegated to the box of pieces rather that display.  It's still Lego and the kids still had fun, but only a good set, not great.

title: Short and Sweet Build
text: I like the concept of these 4+ builds. They are good entry level sets for young builders and have for the most part been good kits.  They are simplistic builds and have few and often oversized fused base pieces.  This is a nice build in that it has an easy to assemble dragon which should be very popular with new builders.  I love that it has two minifigures, but it was a little too easy for our Tweens and pretty much was instantly regulated to the spare parts bin and was quickly cannabalized into a new build. Nice set, not great.

title: Easy Learn, Did not Inspire Our Tweens
text: We got this mainly because of its age range and its suggestion that it would improve our brains.  It turns out to be something of a variant of the memory game which is pretty universal, but our kids were not excited to play it, or play it again.  Perhaps this would be better for kids younger than the tweens.  I'm sure it does improve cognitive abilities, but did not strike a chord in our household.

title: An interesting build and play set
text: We have some Lego purists who really rebelled at the idea of having a pre-made plastic box that contains this set.  The prefer to have no pieces that are specifically molded for such a core purpose in a set.  They believe it should all be made out of existing pieces like the Idea Story Book did.  Putting their dogmatic rules aside, this is an interesting little set.  There are a few pieces added to the outside of the box like the clasp mechanism but the core of the build is the little castle and the micro figures.  It is a nice little self contained playset that would work well with youngsters who want a build they can actively play with.  It is cute and nice little build.  I really liked it.  Kids built it in 15 minutes while arguing its merits, but they had fun.

title: One of the Most Surprising and Unique Sets from Lego in a While
text: We really like this set, it is unique and a wonderful idea.  From packaging to concept this set sticks out of the Lego line as an innovative fresh idea.  Especially nice is how well it fits into and invigorates the Ninjago line, spurring as much interest in the line for our household as the Ninjago movie did.  The two character, idea is great and having one of the characters be able to stand in the screen of the arcade game is visually great.  We had a great time building this and I think it will sit on the display shelves for a long, long time.  Great job Lego!

title: Perhaps one of the best Lego sets for the price point
text: This is one of the cutest, most playable sets I have ever seen for the price.  It is a great little catamaran with Moana and her pet pig.  It displays well, especially with the companion island.  The kids had it together in no time and although they are perhaps older than this playset is directed at, they were very impressed with it.  This would be a perfect small gift for a lover of the movie or Legos in general.  Well done Lego!

title: Well This was a Wonderfully Bizarre Set
text: This is one of the more unusual builds we have ever done.  My youngest loved the Trolls movie and was excited to get this and other Lego Trolls sets.  I think maybe I am more of a conservative traditionalist when it comes to Lego sets and was a little put off by the bright colors and huge balloon pieces.  I let him do the build and he was done in about 15 minutes.  He said it was a fun build and he says he is going to keep it together.  I defer to him about liking the set, but it does have some very interesting pieces if it comes to rebuild and there are some absolutely unique pieces in this set.

title: Great Battle Pack
text:
I was supposed to get a this kit through Amazon Vine, but they ended up sending the Mandalorian Battle Pack instead. Which at the time was fantastic news, but disappointing that we were not getting a set of the Red Stormtroopers, so we headed out and bought this one locally. We absolutely love the Star Wars battle packs and have enough storm troopers to fill out most of the 501st.

This particular pack is nice in that it features the red troopers seen in the last Star Wars movie. they have gone immediately on displays with the others. The little speeder is not the greatest build, which is often the case with Battle Packs. It is a quick little build but not the strongest. I foresee it being cannibalized in the future. But as far as Battle Pack sets go, we are pretty happy with this one.

title: Perhaps a Good Kit for Kids
text:
This actually seems like a throw back to the 70's Lego sets. I didn't find the build overly satisfying either while building it or looking at the final build. This might be my least favorite Lego set since my kids started collecting them 15 years ago. They didn't even show interest in building it (ages 12-18.) So it seems like this may have just been too young a set so this Lego family to appreciate. We didn't even care for the pieces in general.

This was a surprisingly disappointing kit for modern Legos.

title: Good Booster Set for Your Collection
text: I like this set.  270 pieces is not an overwhelming amount, and what I usually like from these sets are a large number of less specialized building pieces which are often missing in most builds, the two by four bricks etc. This kind of does that but in a limited way.  There are a number of colors like hot pink that are not ones that we are looking for.  I would have prefered more bricks per color and less colors overall.  There are some good elements like windows and roofing pieces, but again, not enough of any one to make them usable for larger builds.  So it is a limited, but good set.

title: A Solid Little Car
text: I think this Speed Champion line has a lot of potential.  They are solid little cars filled with detailed stickers and fun builds and displayable models.  This Nissan is actually one of the best in the line for being a cool finished product.  In general I am not a huge fan of overly stickered pieces because it limits rebuild flexibility, but it just looks so cool as a finished product that this one will probably remain a display piece.  I really love this little build.

title: A Great Travel Chess Set
text: I really like this set, it is beautiful and for less than $15 a great little value and/or gift. the pieces are nice although a little big for the board.  I like the squares to be a little bigger to be able to see the pieces on the board better, but it is very workable.  It is a very good travel solution and will be going into the Boundary Waters Canoe Area this summer for some quiet backwoods chess.  The bonus queens are ok, but in reality second queens are pretty rare and an upside down rook works well (although not magnetized.) Highly recommend this set for any chess fan looking for a portable set.

title: A Great Sequel to Silver
text:
The best thing this adds to the original Silver is adding more ways to mess with other players hands. My favorite is the ability to shuffle a players facedown blind cards so they know longer know where their cards are. That is a great twist for the game.

For those who are not familiar with Silver, it is very much like the classic card game Golf with a bunch of twists. If you are not familiar with golf...you are trying to get the least amount of points by trading out high cards for low cards. To replace a blind card you need to replace it with a low card. This could be good or you could be handing a great card to the next player. Once you know you have the lowest points you announce it and everyone gets one more round to get lower than you. If you are the lowest, you get no points. If you are wrong you get your hand plus a penalty. That basic concept plays through Silver and Golf.

Where Silver differs is that you have some beautifully illustrated cards that have additional actions other than just values like Golf. Also, there is a mechanism to remove pairs so you can actually remove a card from your hand (village.) And like I said, even more in this version, unlike Golf, you can mess with your neighbors. It is a great improvement on a classic game concept.

title: Interesting Twist to a Classic Game
text:
There have been a number of games based on the the concept of the Golf card game. Like that game, the point of this game is to have the lowest amount of points in your hand while having a number of blind cards that may be high or low. So you need to replace them while possibly and accidentally passing a great card to the next player in the discard pile. Much like Golf, once you think you have the best hand, you call and end to the game and everyone gets one more round to try to improve them hands. If you are lowest, you get zero points, if you are not, you take a penalty.

So that is the basic idea behind the game, but from there, there are many twists to make the game more interesting. Each card has a secret ability to allow you to see the other card in your village (hand.) Also, there is a mechanism to remove duplicate cards which allows you to quickly dump a lot of points from your hand (village.)

The cards are very nice, the amulet is also nice and allows you to lock a great card so that neither you or others can mess with it. The box could be a lot smaller, basically this is a deck game with a single piece for locking a card. you could put it into a box for a pack of hoyles cards.

All in all, an interesting twist on a classic card game concept.

title: Wonderfully Unique, Fun Game
text:
This is very different from anything we have played before. It is very quick to learn and very quick to play. I love that it is cooperative which keeps most hurt feelings down. It played well at a range of ages from 11 to 51 which was also fantastic. All in all, I am very impressed with this game.

The play is very easy...at first. Basically, you are passing cards to help each other make sets and cover the numbers on a phone keypad. There are rules governing how to pass and who to pass too and lots of communication as you try to get cards where they need to go. You can also make sets of cards that allow you to extend your game by flipping your one minute timer. We found the first round pretty easy actually, and then came the twists... It has a good variety of challenges that make a nice straight forward game more challenging.

I highly recommend this game. There are few games that can be learned so quickly, play accross some many ages, and be so fun and engaging. They hit it all on this one.

title: Nice Collectibles
text: I have been getting these for my youngest son who absolutely loves nearly any collectible.  I like these because, while they are not inexpensive, they don't feel cheap and my son loves Fortnite.  He has a pretty good collection and with the amount of figures out there, I don't have to worry about them running out any time soon.  I truly think they are one of the best Fortnite licensed items out there.  The vehicle sets in particular are nice.  The duo packs are sometimes over priced but keep an eye on them and there are some bargains out there.  Love these.

title: Great Gift for the Young Geologist
text:
These sets are never overwhelming, but I'm fairly impressed with this one. I got the 200 piece fossil, geode and rock collection. The fossils are ok, they are not museum quality but good enough. There were two whole geodes and one opened half of a geode. All are Keokuk geodes, the half is ok, one geode is pretty good, but the other is not so great. Some of the other rocks are good, like I got a very good rose quartz and the tumbled rocks are all pretty good.

The outer box is good and very giftable. Inside there are a number of plastic zip lock bags that are less wonderful packaging, but fine. There is also a nice little faux leather bag that will hold at least all the tumbled rocks. For some reason, our whole box was filled with grit, but it did not seem to come from the bagged rocks. All in all, this is a great starter or filler set for a young geologist.

title: Great Nerf Fortnite Repro
text:
I actually like this gun much better in the Nerf version than I do in game in Fortnite. I rarely use this gun in game, but Nerf's reproduction is solid! It has a wonderfully satisfying pump action which just feels good and sounds very substantial. The look matches the gun very well and the mega darts fly well and true. I was hoping it would use the standard darts, but after holding this for a while, it is obvious that this gun is so heavy feeling that it needs the force and momentum of the larger darts just to be consistent in its heft.

The kids were in awe of it and took about 3 minutes before testing out if it hurt. It did. We have a lot, a whole lot, of nerf guns and this one has a special place in the armory. Good quality feel, great franchise tie in, great gun.

title: Love the Battle Royale Collection
text: My youngest collects all kinds of miniatures and this is my favorite set to get him.  The are not inexpensive, but they are also not cheap.  The are decent quality for the most part.  Some of the representations are not great, but these two guys, Sub Commander and Havoc look pretty good. I love the accessories and the figures articulation and I love the size and scope of the collection in general.  I'm sure we will have a lot of these before we are done.

title: Perhaps my favorite part of the series
text:
This really captures the old All Terrain Kart from Fortnite. My kids love it and it brings back a lot of memories of a couple seasons ago. The details are good, although the ornaments in the from window could be a little sharper. But it truly is my favorite item in the Battle Royale Collection and a perfect thing to recreate. Kudos on the decision. The figure that comes with it is good as well.

All in all we have loved this collection, and this one sits in the center of it.

title: Possibly One of the Most Bizarre Lego Sets Ever
text:
The idea of a jewelry box is wonderful. The collection of oddball pieces to adorn and top it is a little disconcerting. The horse piece in particular seems to be well against Lego norms and sits poorly with the older builders in the house. But for the younger ones it is great. In fact there is a lot of great little pieces here.

The box itself is nice although a little cluttered with adornment, and the stuff that can be added to the top makes it lose its shape and get very cluttered looking. But for young builders, it has a huge amount of creative potential and for older builders, it has a great collection of odd pieces to rebuild with. Probably should be four and a half stars since my son loves it and I'm less strong on it.

title: Cute and Realistic
text:
I got this for my son who is in love with stuffed animals and it definitely had some wow factor. We actually have the Moose has even more grandeur, but this has a similar realism and statue although a little shorter and cuter. It did take some work to get the ears to stick up properly after shipping, but they look good now. It has a place of honor in his room and he is very much in love with it.

In general Melissa and Doug does fantastic with its plushes. This one could have a more elegant line down its back, but all in all it is a very nice stuffed animal. For me it is hard to get anything else after starting to collect these.

title: Great Build, What Technic Line Does Best
text:
My oldest son has always wanted a Technic crane and this fit the bill perfectly. He took most of the afternoon building it and the rest showing everyone the mechanical features of extending the crane and putting out the braces. He was also super excited about the track pieces and other gear pieces.

This really is what Lego Technic does best and this is an awesome set! Keep it up Lego.

title: Great Build!
text:
I recently got the Lego Mini Rally set, and as a former Mini owner, I was ecstatic. But after building it, I said, I wish they made more of these, like a Porsche would be awesome, and here it is. It is a pretty nice representation (not quite as good as the mini though.) The pieces are very nicely chosen and it really has the look of the 911 except for the squared off pieces just behind the headlamps, those a little boxy and out of the proportions of the 911, but overall, a fantastic representation.

The build was fast, 15 minutes fast, but fun. I kept this one from the kids and did it on my own as this was a dream car when I was a kid. Lego, please keep making sets like this, it was fantastic. Perhaps my other childhood dream car, the Mercedes 450 SL.

title: Great Elements! Nice Short Build
text: This has a lot for both Lego and Potter fans.  There are so many great pieces and details.  We love the gray minifigure sculpture and the Tom Riddle grave stone which is perfect for the big fans of the series.  The build did not take long and we had it together in under 20 minutes and it makes a nice little diorama.  It is pretty unique and a great addition to our Harry Potter Lego collection for both pieces and for the build.  Apparently there are still some great builds coming from this franchise.  Keep them coming!

title: Great Architecture Set
text:
This thing is absolutely beautiful. Lego has totally nailed the Empire State Building in micro architecture size. I have had the chance to visit the building a few times over the year and this build is just a treasure. The one by two grates are perfect for capturing the windows and the tower is masterfully represented. I love the finished build and this thing is never being taken apart.

The build itself was about three hours of non rushed building. It is a little repetitive which is a little boring and a little meditative. You need to build several of the facades repeatedly so you get pretty used to it and the pieces are a little repetitive. They really did a great job with the building without a ton of different bricks. I did have a little help from my kids, but I did this as a mostly adult build and can't say enough good things.

This is a perfect marriage of object and building bricks. Highly Recommend!

title: An interesting new Lego Line
text:
This was a pretty big build with lots of good parts and minifigures. The kids were drooling over the train parts and trestles to add to their current limited supply of train parts. But they were also interested in trying the interactive app. They downloaded it first but were a little disappointed that they needed to build the train before using it. In some ways that seems to be a unapologetic marketing trick to force you to buy the whole line.

They tore into the build and had it put together in a couple hours that were interupted by supper. They enjoyed the build and I appreciate the actions on the engine like the pop out wings with side panels that raise up allowing the wings to pop out. The action is a little stiff, but satisfying. the opening hood that becomes a mouth is also interesting, although it all comes out a little childish to me. The whole line seems a little childish, but it is obviously aimed at a younger audience that is addicted to screens and collecting.

Once built they tried the app and enjoyed it well enough. It seems to be a little like pokeman go in that you collect the ghosts. It has simple game play and some interesting interaction with the set. It is a little kitschy, and a little fun but not a lasting game. Definitely seems marketing driven.

But all in all, it is a fun set, it has some incredible pieces and while the set will probably be cannabalized quickly, it was enjoyed a lot during the build. Nice set.

title: Absolutely Adorable
text: We have a number of Melissa and Doug plushes and they are all treasured. This is a very good likeness of a red panda with all the cuteness that entails.  The size is good, basically lifesized, which is biggish, but not to the point that it takes up too much room to keep in a room.  The fur is wonderfully soft and overall it has the high quality that I expect from Melissa and Doug.  Love it!

title: Son Loves Collecting These
text: My son was very happy to get this nice sized building collection.  He is an avid figurine collector and an avid Fortnite player so this is two of his biggest loves coming together.  The figures are small and over all the set is not too big, but it is flexible and playable.  It also does a great job of displaying his collection which is about 12 figures at this point.  It's a decent set for the price and comes with two characters he was happy to get.  He gives an enthusiastic five stars.

title: Holy Moly, this comes with Shock and Awe
text: This penquin is absolutely huge.  But it is only the first shock you get, the second if when you touch it and find out how soft it is.  This is truly an amazing plush that any kid would love to receive.  I love that it is pretty realistic as well.  the gradation of the orange cheeks is great and all in all it looks fantastic.  We have a couple of other oversized plushes, one being Doug and Melissa's moose and this fits right in.  It's fantastic, even at its $99 price.  Perfect for birthday or Christmas.

title: My youngest loves this bear
text: I am very happy with this bear.  It is a good price for a 19 inch bear at $15.  It is wonderfully soft and the sweater is very cute. It is super soft and manufacturing seems fine.  The only thing I would hold against it is that it comes in a bag that makes it look like the victim of a snuff film.  It is a little disturbing to see it wrapped tightly in plastic.

title: A Great Nostalgic Set
text:
I have to admit that on first brush I was a little disappointed with this set, I track the Lego Ideas site and I remember there being a number of appliances driven by prehistoric creatures and a big turkey on a spit etcetera. This final set that went through the master designers dropped all of that. But I do have to admit, I think they did a better job with the walls and roof than the original idea designer. It really captures the house, as does the car. The dino ribs that were featured in the opening scenes is a great idea for the set, but it is a little crude in its final appearance. I was worried about the minifigures, but in the end, I'm happy with how they look.

The build was decently fun and took us an afternoon of building with a lot of talking. Much of it was telling my kid about the show which he was aware of but had not really watched. For a Gen X'er this brought back some nostalgia. It's a nice nostalgic set which was decently designed, but it really needed a baby mammoth vacuum cleaner and a Dino to be truly great.

title: A Nice, Playable Technic Build
text: We don't get a lot of Technic builds but we have been pretty happy with all the ones we have gotten over the years.  I like that they often involve mechanical gearing or other real world engineering concepts.  This line is nice for its pull back motor action.  This makes these cars much more playable as toys once constructed.  The build was quick - twenty minutes or so - and the finished model is pretty solid.  I'm not the biggest fan of Technic's ability to represent vehicles, I think I prefer a good classic Lego set, but the kids loved this and it is a great set for below $20.  Can't celebrate Lego's enough.

title: Fortnite Maniac Son Loves These
text: These are absolutely perfect for my youngest son whose two biggest manias are Fortnite and cheap little collectibles.  Now I do not consider these inexpensive at $5 a figure, but he has purchased a lot of them at that price or more that did not seem to have the quality of these.  They seem small to be and they are not the highest quality, but they are acceptable quality.  There are a number of nice little accessories and all are recognizable as parts of the game.  We got a derp burger and another rather generic skin but he loves that they are unique to his collection which is now above 20.  They do display well and are lightly poseable although their hand grips are a little questionable and I've noticed that some gun barrels seem to be warped.  But my son would not allow me to give anything less than five stars for these.  For now we found the perfect stocking stuffer/small gift idea.

title: Fun, Easy to Learn Game
text:
We play a very similar game called Golf. I'm sure it has a ton of other names, but basically it is exactly the same game with unicorns instead of jokers and some swap, peek and spy actions added. The added actions are nice in that it makes the game a little more interactive amongst players. In normal Golf you play only your own cards. These new rules allow you to steal other players cards and help judge whether you have the low hand.

This is a fun game that you can easily teach someone in a couple minutes or at worst, one practice round of about five minutes. The cards are good quality and we are planning on packing it on a camping trip as they are pretty thick. The art is nice, but mostly I'm impressed by the thick, sealed quality of the cards.

Perfect for get togethers, fun, easy to learn, good for young and old. Highly Recommend.

title: Nerf and Fortnite, YES!
text:
This really seems like a match made in heaven. It is a mashup of two of our household's favorite things. Also, it is one of the best branded product line from Fortnite which has seemed to have a troubled branding the right products. But now they seem to have found the proper product licensing options.

OK, we did get this at a less than opportune time, 43 degrees and raining is not very conducive to water gun battles, but there was no keeping the kids from trying this out. And it is a decent water gun. It has range and accuracy and puts out an OK stream. It isn't breaking any records, but we were happy with it functionality and the pump action. I'm a little less than thrilled with the overall construction. I think more thought could go into it as well as more details and parts. It is basically just a few large molded pieces with a limited palette. Much could be done to improve the aesthetics, but the price point is pretty low so I guess you get what you pay for.

But this is easily five stars based on the boys reactions to it. Bring on the summer!

title: Love These Minifigure Series
text:
Well, perhaps the Disney minifigures are not my favorite series, but they are all good. I received a reviewer product and got Scrooge McDuck which would have been my choice out of this series. It would be great to have a good collection of all of them.

These series have better than average examples of minifigures. They have the high quality we have come to expect from Lego and they make perfect gifts. I probably won't get many more Disney Minifigures, but will definitely get more of these from other series.

title: Decent Piece Filler
text: We have a lot of legos in our home.  Cubic yards of Legos. We have sets from dozens of the Lego lines and a couple of these which are mostly just basic filler bricks that do help us with basic builds like buildings, but they lack many of the special pieces that come with other sets.  They had a similar line of sets with many specialized pieces as an anniversary set, but this is just a collection of basic pieces.  To be honest, this one just got poured out of the bags directly into one of the bins.  I love Legos and glad that we have more, but I have to say that it did not cause much of a stir in our Legos mad household.  Perhaps this is best as a gift to someone with a small collection that could really use a booster set of base pieces.

title: Nice Build, A Little Small
text: We loved this set, especially since we saw the movie just before building it. I was a little disappointed that the Mech suit is kind of small, I was expecting a little bigger.  The kids had it put together in about 15 minutes and had a good time putting it together. I do wish it was a little bigger, but overall it is a nice set.

title: A Fun Build
text:
We have not built too many Technic sets, but when we have we have been impressed by the design and the special mechanical features. This set is no different, we loved the pull back mechanism that makes this a very playable toy as well as a interesting build. It holds together well and will not simply fall apart like some sets that are tempremental about play. This is not just a display only build.

The kids had this whipped out in less than a half hour and unanimously said that it was a good set. Bring on more sets like this Lego!

title: Lego at its best!
text:
This is truly what Lego does best, create wonderful and recognizeable builds based on vehicles from movies or real life. It is a great build that is also very playable and just a treasure to have. In particular, this build is rock solid, has some very interesting details and actions and sits in your hand like a heavy and valuable piece of art. It is perhaps the densest, heaviest vehicle we have built for its size.

The minifigures are generous in number and perfect for fans of the Avengers. Love the rocket (wish there was a groot.) and love that they all fit well into the final build. The swing up gun is a little awkward to move, but otherwise fantastic.

The kids had a blast with the build which took less than an hour but a good amount of time. They were very happy to get it and even more impressed with the finished product. Highly, highly recommend this set.

title: Interesting and Different Set from Lego
text:
This is an interesting idea that I have not seen from Lego before. I like the target practice concept using the old canon parts that are pretty classic. I would have been nice to design a little more of a build around them, but they have always been one of the best functioning guns that Lego has in its arsenal. Coupling that with some classic Star Wars and you have a great build.

I love the Hoth theme and it's a good selection of minifigures. I also like the action on the ATAT when you hit the block from between its legs. very reminiscent of Empire Strikes back. In fact all the actions are interesting and they have kept the boys engaged. They have brought the set out a few times to have new target practice. All in all a great set!

I

title: An Interesting Build, Great Pieces
text:
I have two sons who love making their own creations and while building this, they were drooling over the parts they could reuse. We were not familiar with the Star Wars Resistance Series, but we are familiar with the component parts of this build. It is a lot of reconstituted Tie Fighter parts but comes together as a decent build that fits the Star Wars universe for sure. We just need to start watching Resistance

The build took the boys about 20 minutes with much discussion and planning to reuse the parts already. They really liked it and liked having a Po Dameron to add to their minifigure wall. The rated it five out of five stars and I loved watching them enjoy building it.

title: Love this Set
text: We are huge fans of Lego Star Wars and we are ecstatic to see Anniversary packs that bring back old favorites.  This one is definitely a favorite too as we owned the original drop ship.  The addition of a nearly original Han Solo is pretty cool too, although my oldest son points out that there is a large screen printing on his back that says twentieth anniversary.  He also pointed out that you can never have too many storm troopers.  and this set comes with a wonderful squad of them.  He grabbed it as soon as it arrived and built in in 15 minutes and admired it for twice that long.  Great Set!

title: Interesting build
text:
We didn't realize that this is a 4+ Lego build. The model and the minifigures are great, but the pieces are huge and few in number. It is a great entry to the world of brick building as the builds are easy and pieces are fairly few and easy to manage. My kids slapped it together immediately but remarked a lot about how the ship pieces were huge, where they would often be several pieces in other builds, here they have one piece as the base of the ship.

The build was fun and the A wing looks great so we are very happy with it. I kind of wish we had these sets 12 years ago. Recommend for the young builder.

title: Very Good Battle Pack
text: We have long been huge fans of battle packs and this one is pretty amazing.  Often the builds that come with the minifigures are pretty bare bones, and actually this one might be too except that there are great actions built into it.  I love that you can manipulate the minis into action and we absolutely love having the Praetorian Guards in our collection.  Details are great, builds is quick but fun...Keep bringing out sets like this.  Highly recommend.

title: Great Build, Very playable
text: The kids were possibly even a little intimidated by this set as they did not leap right into it when it arrived.  But once going they had a great time building it and they were full of discussion as the builds came together.  In the end they had two rather quirky models that I am told are perfect for the Ninjago world and they said it definitely is a five star set.  I kind of like the oversized mini figure and that the car is something they will probably keep together and play with for a while before cannibalizing it into their creative builds.  Well worth it for the fun that they kids had building this.

title: Nice Little Battle Pack
text: I love battle packs for their mini figures although the included build is often pretty minimal.  In this case, you get three nice little black armored stormtroopers and one with a female head.  To be honest, I was not sure what the pack was representing, but my oldest son pointed out that it is from the Battlefront games.  We put it together in about 15 minutes and the ship is pretty minimal, but the set is well worth it for the mini figures.  Love Lego Star Wars!

title: Nice Little Spinjitzu Pack
text:
We have had a couple of the evolutions of the Spinjitzu and this one is a nice little build. It does look pretty authentic to the shows and it does have some fun interactivity. The action is from a finger spin, but it holds the spin fairly well and your little ones can have fights with these. Our kids have very much enjoyed the sets, they are quick builds but for a set in itself it is pretty small and has Cole, a character we have a plethora of. Kids love it though and we all love Lego!

Now that we have two of this set we have been battling and the battle action is pretty good.

title: Love the Microfighter Collection
text: These cute, mini sets have been adorable since their inception and the current entries are no different.  This is a spot on Naboo Starfighter just like the movie with an very cute scale twist.  It was a very quick build of less than 15 minutes and now it sits with a half dozen other microfighters.  I really hope they keep this line going, especially if it goes back to the early movies.  They truly are my favorites.  They are inexpensive, collectible and loveable.

title: Nice Little Spinjitzu Pack
text: We have had a couple of the evolutions of the Spinjitzu and this one is a nice little build. It does look pretty authentic to the shows and it does have some fun interactivity.  The action is from a finger spin, but it holds the spin fairly well and your little ones can have fights with these.  Our kids have very much enjoyed the sets, they are quick builds but for a set in itself it is pretty small and has Kai, a character we have a plethora of.  Kids love it though and we all love Lego!

title: One of my favorite sets of all time
text:
OK, this one is not going to the kids. I owned a Mini for a long time and it seemed like the perfect car for Legos and this set proves it. I am pretty nostalgic of that car and love that we have a Lego version of it (although mine was yellow.) I saved this for myself to build and loved it. It took about 40 minutes with some interuptions and I really like the results.

I love the structure, which is actually no more than kind of a stage to feature the cars. But it frames a little diorama of the Mini and a lifted Mini buggy well on my shelf. The cars are well detailed and as cute as Minis in real life. The set inspires play or for me, pleasure of display for this one.

Definitely brought the kid out of this fifty year old. Kudos to Lego for a great set!

title: Cute Small Set, Limited Build
text: I think this is a great size for stocking stuffers and party gifts but the build is very short (less than 7 minutes) and leaves you with a minifigure, a small structure and a couple of nice but little detail pieces.  The kids built it and enjoyed building it, but the future of this set is to augment our pieces collection.  Love Legos, and this is a nice little set, but ultimately, it is little on it's own.

title: Minecraft and Lego are a Perfect Marriage
text:
My kids were raised on Minecraft and continue to return to the game years and years later. The whole game is perfect for rendering into a three dimension Lego creation at its very core and we have a large number of the sets. Some of the sets are stronger than others but all in all they have been well loved, if for no other reason than they include a vast amount of parts that can go into other builds. Both the game and Lego make for amazing creative outlets.

This set in particular is pretty strong. While I find the overall blockiness less exciting than other Lego franchises, my kids really love that they look like the game. They were very excited about the pirate ship and in joining this to some other sets that they had built. They have their own designed Minecraft world on a shelf to display the creatures and characters from these sets and created a little lake for this boat to sit on.

The build took most of an hour if you include creating the lake to put it on, and they had a blast. That is definitely worth 5 stars!

title: Wonderful Build from Lego
text:
I will have to admit that I am a bit of a purist and did not like the introduction of the friends line, but this one has some fantastic elements. First, just the overall amount of small details from scissors and pets to the little paint bottles which I think are brilliant in their simplicity and what makes legos great. This set reminds me of Playmobil and their attention to details in the accessories.

Where these sets often go wrong is by making a very simplistic façade for the building. The structure in this build is small, but still substantial. It is not a just a front wall and a couple of side builds, it is a small but complete building. At this price point, what you get is very impressive, and I would love to have a city of builds like this. Especially if the build design is as solid. Especially at $25.

The set is surprisingly filled with illustrated pieces. Sometimes that limits using the pieces in your own constructions, but these are pretty nice and especially the large panels will be nice in other building designs. The water reveal canvas seems a little kitchy, but again a nice detail.

All in all, This is a great set for the price.

title: Kind of Goofy, but with Great Detail Parts
text:
I'm not a huge fan of the Friends and Disney Princess sets, but my kids love them and they love all the detailed little items and animals that come with them. In this case the dolphin, frog and squirrel are very treasured. The structures a little minimalist, but welcome as we have a lot of these parts that are now making them able to create sprawling castles. It took them about a half hour of casual building to put this set together and another half hour to reconstitute it into another castle with other Disney characters.

I love how creative the kids get with Legos and look forward to more years of play.

title: Love Creator Sets
text:
Creator is one of our favorite lines. Love the flexibility out of the box and love the parts they come with. My kids built the car and camper as we already have a better space shuttle kit. They enjoyed making the build and while I'm sure that this one will not stay together, the pieces will be loved for years.

Like I said, there are better camper, shuttle and truck kits out there. The helicopter is actually not even that great, but for a kit that can do all of them, it is pretty amazing. The builds are blockier than a lot of the creator builds but the part selection is good. Kids were more excited about the pieces than the builds actually.

title: Wonderful Idea, Great Build
text:
This is an amazing idea from the Lego Ideas collection. Although, to be honest the whole line has been great. It took a while to get this put together, and I really appreciate the thought that went behind it. The set has an amazing collection of specialty parts, although I don't see this on being dismantled any time soon.

It is truly and inspired idea to make a pop up book with legos. It is limited in how big the pop up can be, but the effect is very good. Can't say enough good things about Legos, the kids have loved them for over a decade and I have for multiple decades. Keep more sets like this coming!

title: Nice Little Set
text: I've never been a huge fan of the Princess line, but my youngest definitely is. This set has many interesting pieces and built into an interesting little structure.  I don't think it will be kept in one piece for long but the pieces will definitely find a home in our collection, and I love that there are some good house and building pieces.  The kids built it in about 15 minutes and had some fun with it.  They really like the dove piece which is unique in our collection.  Got to love Legos for quality and creative play.  This is a nice, but not overwhelming set.

title: Kids Love It!
text:
We have a number of these reversing sequin pillows and this is among the cutest. The kids love the tactile interaction of flipping the sequins back and forth, although this one seems to have the least change from one side to the other of any we have. Pretty much the unicorn goes from flat to metallic shiny and the mane's color scheme swaps. Most have far more dramatic transformations.

The back side of the pillow is wonderfully soft so you do have one side that will act like a pillow while the other is definitely less comfortable. We all love it and it is a wonderfully cute throw pillow.

title: Decent Game, Not sure how much it will come out
text:
It took us a while to get around to playing this game despite a lot of excitement for the theme. We did actually enjoy playing the game after watching a couple of play through videos and getting the gyste. The rules are fairly easy when you follow the five action sequences and it is an interesting strategy game of resources and production capability.

We really like the theme and some of the details, like how important ketchup seems to be in the post apocalypse world. We played through in about and hour which is a good length for a game and all in all we thought the game was pretty good, but no one really wanted to tear into another round and we started playing star realms instead. We'll see how much play time it gets. It is decent, but doesn't feel like a go to game.

title: My Son Loves It
text:
It was surprising how much this plush toy does. It dances, it responds to pats and voices, and plays multiple songs. It dances and moves by way of a solid plastic base with small wheels which allow it to move in a little line dance kind of way - think electric slide - as well as move back in response to you saying "Baby Shark!" The wheels are small so it will only work on smooth surfaces, and the plastic base takes away a lot of its snugglibility, but it is impressive in its ability to move.

The build seems pretty good. The eyes and features are embroidered in and it looks pretty solid. Parents, make sure you are ready hear the song a few more hundred times.

title: Bizarre Fortnite Branding
text: Our kids are all about all things Fortnite, but I have not been overly impressed on their product placement choices.  The kids claim that they love these, but the seem pretty pointless to me.  They are cute to play with for a while and they do have an unusual movement, but I don't know that they really say Fortnite.  Nor do I think that they will be played with long or often.  They are simple baubles like fidget spinners, but they kids loved those too.  So who knows.  I will give them four stars because the kids were very happy to get some.

title: Great Build, One Broken Part
text:
We are a Lego family with kids who are fanatically Lego only zealots. They have not been willing to look at any Lego clones except for the Mega Construx Call of Duty sets. They have made a special exception because the builds have been so good, although they are sectioned off to their own display shelf.

This build was no different. The details in the truck are fantastic with lots of small pieces. In the past we have taken days to finish Mega Construx build with this many pieces, but we finished this one in one marathon, multi builder session. The wheels are great, the weapons are great, everything is great and the truck proudly sits in a convoy of other armored vehicles.

The only bad part is that there was a broken piece that required some sanding and filing to allow the truck cab to sit in place and tilt open properly. In countless Lego sets, we have never had a broken piece, but we have had a couple in Mega Construx. The details are great, but the quality is slightly behind Lego. But if Mega Construx makes another military vehicle like this, it will be on our wish lists.

title: An interesting Build
