This was broken, right out of the box.
1.The trigger is frozen. I will not move.
2. The screw holding the battery cover is ripped out with the plastic tab still attached
3. One of the springs in the battery compartment is missing.

Amazon customer service was wonderful, resolving this immediately. Thank you Amazon.

title: No way to anchor the pieces so they dont shift
text:
This is really pretty once you set everything in place. The led light, located under the lid, is easy to turn on/off.
The bad news is, when your child (or adult) picks up the finished piece, everything shifts & tumbles about unless you are able to keep it absolutely level while you move it. Once this happens its a nightmare trying to get everything back in place. There are so many small sized beads, you would need to dump it all out, separate every piece & create it again from scratch.
Lovely concept.
Easy for a child to assemble, initially.
Needs a redesign to address the problem of shifting, tumbling pieces when lifted up.

title: Super cute basket
text: We loved hiding & finding these small, bright colored eggs. The cloth bunny basket is adorable & folds flat for easy storage. So happy with this purchase

title: Too messy
text:
I wanted to love this, but it is very messy & not really moldable.
The tiny styrofoam like balls separate from the chunk & stick to any surface they land on. My 3 yr old granddaughter did not like her hands to feel so sticky. We tried to make simple animals & a snowman, but it's very much like trying to mold Rice Crispy Treats.
The colors are bright, bold & wonderful. The carry case is great for storage.
This particular item is not fun for us, so I can only give 3 stars

title: Nice size for little hands
text:
Three yr old can use these PlayDoh molds, no problem. The hinged front & back make is easy to line up the front & back when she closes the mold. She can press down with 2 hands and remove her dinosaur, will little to no help. The detail is great.
We were surprised the the 3D dinosaur can actually stand. She had a blast using these molds.
Lots of fun for a great price. I wish they made other sets of animals. I would buy a bunch.

title: So soft
text:
This is a super cuddlie, floppy puppy for the car. 8” long is perfect for toddlers in car seats. The legs are little bean bags & the chenille is soft as can be.
The quality is terrific. This little guy is going to last a long time.

title: Great sticker set for preschoolers
text:
This sticker pack is fantastic! I am going to order a bunch for my grand daughters preschool class.
There are 24 sheets of 4 different Easter critters. The decorating stickers are nice & large & super easy for a 3yr old to remove from the sheets. Vibrant colors & cute expressions. I am just thrilled with every detail of the fun, fun, fun holiday sticker set. Two enthusiastic thumbs UP

title: Nice set for 3 yr old
text:
My 3yr old grand daughter loves this train set. She enjoys putting the tracks together & trying to recreate the bypass circle if tracks. The wooden ball & grove design makes these tracks really easy for little hands. The best feature is the animals fit in the 2 train cars, so she can ride them around. I wish the magnets were stronger, but so far my grand daughter does not complain when the cars come apart while pulling it around a curve.
The little ‘Farm Pen' and ‘Windmill' are nice additions to the play fun.
The reason I took away 1 star is the design of the bridge. To hold the bridge up, you have to balance that 1 section of track on 2 blocks. It's so wobbly, the track piece falls apart with the slightest bump. I am going to super glue the track piece onto the 2 blocks.

title: Adorable tea set
text:
My grand daughter loves to have tea parties with her collection Of FisherPrice Little People animals. This little tea set is perfect.
I was surprised at the detail of each piece, painting & construction. The tea pot lid is even removable.
Eventually, we will get a doll house & this set will be a nice addition.

title: So easy for pre-schoolers
text:
I love these paints for my 3 yr old grand daughters. So easy for them to use. Having paint cakes in recessed holder wells is so much less messy than liquid paint in those “spill proof” cups that are constantly tipping over.
I love that I can put out just a couple of colors at a time. I absolutely love that I can rinse these off & they are good as new - no wasting paint that has to be thrown out cause it's the color of mud.
I was surprised at how big each one is. We will have lots of painting fun before I need to buy more.
No more liquid paints for us. I will be reordering these paint cakes whenever we run out.

title: Another winner
text:
This cookie slicing kit is pretty cool. The wooden cookie dough is easy to slice & the wooden icing fastens right on with velcro. I took of 1 star because:
1. The covers on the ends of the cookie dough tube fall off no matter how much you push them in.
2. The wooden cookie tray is a smidge too wide to slide flat into her oven.
3. We wish there were 2 even mitts rather than one.
We have the M&D Veggie slicing kit which is fantastic, so this is the perfect addition.
My 3yr old grand daughter loves to “bake” & prepare meals. M&D make some really cute & unique cooking toys.

title: Big, big hit! Super giftable
text:
I bought 3 of these sets and “dress frosty” was a big hit with each of the 3 yr. olds I gave them too.
The snowman & all the pieces are a good thickness, helping each piece hold it's shape. The layered pieces are glued together very neatly & securely. The velcro strips on the Snowman are well placed making it easy for little ones to position the pieces. There are a lot of pieces - hats, bow ties, buttons, scarves, arms, mittens & a present.
This kit is well worth the money & we will use it again & again over the next few years.
You will want to open it and lay all the pieces out to flatten the folds before hanging. There is an attached hanging ribbon. I hung ours on the fridge with velcro Command Strips.

title: Vibrant colors
text:
I love the wide bottom bottles. They dont tip over. The colors are all vibrant. My grand daughters eyes lit up when I brought them out. The princesses on each bottle are easily identified. Peels off, as described.
I set expectations before we started so this little 3yr old knew it was for pretend time & we would wash our hands & peel it off when we were done playing (it wont last too long, peels off very easily)
Fun kit & really great colors. The box comes with a carrying handle, which is pretty fun, too.

title: Excellent quality
text:
I was not expecting this little apron & chef's hat to be of such great quality. The material is water resistant yet supple & soft. The construction & stitching is excellent. Nice, deep front pockets will hold baking tools. The neck & waist straps are made of the same material & sewn seams (not just strings tacked on). The unicorn is adorable & the “splash paint” colors are vibrant.
Just like the apron, the chef hat is the same quality material, construction & stitching. There is plenty of room to comfortably tuck a full ponytail into the cap. There is a wide elastic in the back with lots of stretch for a good fit.
At first, I assumed the higher price was due to the super cute design. I was wrong. The price reflects the excellent quality material & workmanship. Well worth the price.

title: Reusable!!!
text:
When I bought these, I expected these to be a one time use item. Turns out these are great quality with attached plastic hooks. Super easy to hang these up for party at grandma's house, then take them down & use them again at home. After the 2nd party, we took them down, layed them flat & put them in a mailing envelope for another time. I am thinking they may come out again for Xmas decorating.
Highly, highly recommend.

title: Inside or outside  - a great set.
text: A really nice tea party set. Very durable. Cute as can be. There have been many tea parties with this set, both inside & outside. Easy to clean, too.

title: Favorite Toy
text:
My 3 yr old grand daughter goes straight to this set, every time she comes to visit. I can say without a doubt, we have never had a toy be “favorite” for this long. She loves cutting up veggies & fruit & cooking them in her oven (my bookcase).
The velcro makes these easy for her to “cut” & then put back together. I thought I would need a storage bag, but she loves the wooden box & can easily get it off the shelf & carry it around. As always, Melissa & Doug make high quality items, right down to rounded edges & smooth chip-free paint. Dont hesitate folks. This set is a winner.

title: Arms & Legs move
text:
We have lots of similar size sesame street figures but these are the first I have bought with articulating arms & legs. Cool feature for a 3 yr old “Dora Adventurer”. Great quality & colors.
She loves them.

title: Not giftable
text: I purchased this for a gift, but it is not giftable. Unfortunately, the one shipped to me was packaged upside down & the apples stamped on the ponies haunches are also upside down. (I chose “Applejack” for the gift). I am suspicious this may be a “knock-off”.  I will donate this one & buy another at a store so I can confirm it's not a “seconds”

title: Painted Shut
text:
It is impossible to open the largest cat, because it is painted shut. You can only see tiny areas of the seam. There are complex, 4 step instructions, indicating the seller knows you cannot open this, including using dental floss.
I am very disappointed in this product.

title: Difficult for pre-schoolers
text:
I was surprised at how difficult this is. Out of the box, I tried to create the fish and was baffled. It took me a a bit to finally figure out, to create the fish tail, you have to cross over the 2 semi-circles. A 3 or 4 yr old child is going to get frustrated expecting pieces to lay flat (as I did). My grand daughter lost interest. My daughter & I tried a few more and the shape combinations to complete the puzzles were quite awkward - we were not impressed.
imho, as listed, this is not age appropriate.

title: 2.5 yr old loves this ‘game'
text:
My 2.5 grand daughter caught on to the color matching pretty quickly. When she completes the cups for a card, she loves to ring the bell. HA!
The quality of the cups, bell & cards is really good. These cards wont rip.
I like the variety of color arrangements on the cards. As they learn the stacking and in-a-row cards, they can move on tho the more challenging spacial placement cards. I can see this being a very useful learning tool for a few years.
I will say, I thought it was a bit pricey for what you get, but the learning opportunities make it worth it.

title: Sturdy set
text: The components of this set are very clear & sturdy, with all rounded edges. Good size for young ones, but still large enough for adults to play along. There are a lot of pieces in this kit, for  the price. The included experiment cards are well presented and very useful. The only reason I cant give 5 stars is it does not include any kind of storage  - bag or box, which is a nuisance, since there are so many pieces you want to keep together. Had to use one of my tote bags..

title: Lots of vibrant colors
text:
Fully saturated with vibrant color. You can tell right away, these will last quite a while and wont dry out. Work great on our pre-schoolers Crayola white board easel. Nice size for her little hands. Do not leak. Easy to clean off white board with water wipes (or you can wash with a regular cloth).
There are cheaper sets, but I am happy we paint a tad extra for this quality.

title: Great quality & shape
text: We have bought many different pkgs of sidewalk chalk and this is, hands down, the best quality for pre schoolers. The square shape is really easy to hold. The tapered tip is great for easy contact with sidewalk or wall. They do now give off much dust. And best of all, they have been dropped many times and have yet to break. The colors are lively but on the pale side. If I find these in vibrant primary colors, I will order a few boxes. Great chalk 👍🏻👍🏻

title: Best puppets money can buy
text: This is the 2nd puppet I've ordered from The Puppet Company. The craftsmanship & quality of materials used is excellent. Fits an adult arm, comfortably. Easy to open n close the mouth & squeak the tongue. We have lots of hand puppets and imo, these are the very best value for the money. The 1st one we got is 2.5 yes old, gets lots of daily toddler love & still looks good as new. No snags, unraveling or broken pieces (eyes, ears, antennas). Dont hesitate to order. You wont be disappointed

title: No leaking - Yay!
text:
These do not leak. yay!
2yr old having lots of fun with these. Cap is easy for her to twist on n off. Never leak no matter how hard she shakes, throws or drops them. It does take a good amount if straight up n down pressure to get the paint flowing, but she had the hang of it now. Like the ease of use & cleanup compared to water color paints n brush.

title: Great quality & value
text:
omg - this was the biggest hit on Christmas morning and still a favorite 2 months later. Do not hesitate to buy this set. You will need 2 AA batteries for the blender. No batteries needed for the toaster. So many great little accessories included. Toast, plates, cups, knives, fruit, butter & jam.
Gave my granddaughter multi colored cotton balls for the blender - the motor is strong enough to spin them all around. (Motor does not spin if she puts the plastic fruits in).
This little set is just the right size for any play kitchen you have. The price is amazing for the quality & hours of fun you toddler will have.

title: Very well made
text: No assembly. Very well made. Two cute kitties fit nicely, lay & stand flat.

title: Perfect size for toddler hands
text:
The size of this set is wonderful! The size of each wooden piece is perfect for toddler hands. The quality is really top-notch!! Every piece is smoothly sanded and the edges are rounded. Each piece is nicely painted. I like the color palette used for both the wooden pieces and play rug. The painted wooden pieces stand out against the rug.
The 4 piece train has rounded magnetic connectors which keep the cars attached when rolling over the curved tracks or just driving around on the rug or floor. The train tracks have nice grooves, which help little hands keep the train on the track. The puzzle ends of the train tracks are easy peasy for toddlers to attach. The RxR crossing track piece has moveable gates on each side. There is also a train track bridge that had a good size tunnel for the vehicles to go thru.

The plastic wheels on all the vehicles are securely attached and roll freely. There are 12 freestanding road signs that stand in square bottoms. The signs are the shapes and colors of actual road signs which is a nice learning feature. The words on the signs are large and easy to read.

The vehicles are very easy to wipe off. The rug is completely bound on all edges and had a non-slip rubber backing. All the images woven into the rug are crisp, large and easily identifiable. One of the best features of this set is the rug is machine washable.

I love this entire set for my grand daughter and highly recommend it. Hours of fun for kids and adults. Definitely stimulates the imagination.

title: Adorable
text:
Nice sturdy frame. Fabric is stretched smoothly over the wing frames. The 2 arm bands are soft and stretchy. No wires poking out. Lovely pastel colors.
Perfect fit for toddlers.
When I first removed them from the bag, I took them outside and shook off the loose sparkles. This worked well and, so far, no problem with sparkles falling off indoors.
Good quality. Good price for the 4 pack.

title: I needed to use tape to assemble
text:
These party had are toddler size, perfect. I was unable to get the to stay securely assembled with the tabs, only. They kept popping apart. Simple solution was to add a piece of tape to each hat. Elastics are nice and long so you can make the short enough for toddlers or long enough for adults.
There were no instructions on how to attach the pompoms. There is a sheet of sticky squares, but I could not figure out how to use them. Might be obvious to most, but I had no luck. Ended up tapping pompoms to tips.
Definitely good value pack. Bright colors. Sturdy cardboard and elestic strings.

title: Great size for toddler hands
text:
Love the animal set. Very nice size and made of thin, sturdy wood so they will last a long time.
For a 2 yr old, it would be nice if the plastic ends were longer (they are too short for little ones to easily push thru the holes). Also, it would be great if there were ‘stopper' beads at one end so they can get the lacing started without it falling thru the first hole every time they try. Too frustrating for 2yr olds.
I am going to order a few round wooden beads to attach to the end of each lace and wrap the ends with colorful tape to make them longer and easier for little tikes to learn to use.

title: No noise blowers
text: Was happy to find sesame street blowers that dont make any noise. The round cardboard decorations are too close to the end for easy blowing, but all I had to do was pinch them and tape to shorten. Now, they are easy for the toddlers to blow and they had a lot of fun with these. Eight pack is great.

title: Love the markers
text: Toddlers love markers, but they can create a mess. These markers are wonderful! They dont leave any color unless used on the special paper. This little set is perfect for my 2 yr old grand. She loves dogs and the pictures on these coloring sheets are bold and happy. It is so much easier for her to color with markers than crayons. The bold strokes of bright colors make her so happy. Great kit for $5.

title: Large numbers are wonderful
text:
This is a really nice set. The large numbers are great. The tiered tile holders have deep grooves, making it very easy to keep your tiles in place. The directions are well organized and very easy to understand. The directions include visual examples of plays showing both ‘what is on the board' and ‘tiles you have' and ‘the play'. So easy to understand.

I bought a 2nd set for my daughter's house.

title: Perfect for a 2 yr old
text:
This is such a cute little doll stroller! Takes 30 seconds to snap in the front wheels, lock in place and it's ready. The wheels roll smoothly. It is light enough for a toddler to roll all around the house without getting stuck. It has all the cute details of mamas stroller, including the pull down sun hood with ruffled edge, the seatbelt and a carry basket in the rear that is deep enough to hold small toys. The handle has ridged finger grip along the top for no-slip pushing. The denim fabric is strong enough that a toddler wont tear it even with rough use. The height is perfect for a 2 yr old. The handle does not extend to grow with your child, but for a mere $20, its a really nice little stroller. Great deal!
To fold, you simply slide the plastic ‘locks' up and push down on the handle. Folds flat and will easily slide under the couch, bed or bookcase.

It's sturdy enough to take outside for a sidewalk stroll. Love it

title: Nice size hand held toy
text:
The first thing I noticed when I opened the box is this is a nice, large hand held toy. Small enough for young hands and large enough to make it easy to track and retrieve when flying outdoors. The bright red and white colors also make it easy to find.
Assembly is simple - place the rotary on top of the plane and click into place.
The instructions tell you to place the plane on top of the launcher hand grip and pull the string. Our first few tries, we were having a hard time trying to hold it straight so the top of the launcher grip was level, otherwise the plane kept falling off when we tried to pull the string, which was extremely frustrating, especially for a pre-schooler. Eventually I figured out, if you placed it on top of the launcher grip and gave it a gentle clockwise turn, the small metal bar under the plane would seat into the gear and remain in place until you pulled the string. Now it was fun to fly.
The action of the pull string is smooth and so far it has fully retracted to the original position after each flight. I did notice, when I turned the launcher grip over, there is a hole in the bottom and I can see the rubber band. It looks like a narrow, generic rubber band so I am not expecting this to last very long before the rubber band breaks due to dirt getting into the hole or the elastic drying out and cracking. Wont last as long as a spring loaded, twist-on, trigger release design.
As expected, the faster you pull the string, the higher it flies. Fun to fly outside with pre-schoolers. They love chasing after it.
IMHO, this is pricey for the design/quality, but it is pretty fun for kids once you figure out how to seat the plane to prevent it from falling off the grip launcher. I wont be surprised when the rubber band breaks.

title: 2yr old loves this set
text:
My 2 yr old grand daughter loves this set. Dolls, Stuffed Animals, Mama, Daddy, Puppets...... everyone gets fed. The pieces are very will made, just the right size for little hands and super easy to wash. I am delighted with this set.

I had to laugh because I was sure the magic bottles would be the biggest hit. Nope, she just loves the 2 small jars with lids and the spoon. Everyone gets lots of “soup”. Adorable!

title: Book is extremely heavy
text:
The Pop-a-Dots are a novel tactile experience for any little kid. The initial excitement is lots of fun. The color pallet is bright. The layout of the book is excellent:
1. The beginning of the book contains 14 pages showing 2 letters of the alphabet, per page, with a “Look for:” list of words at the bottom of the page. There are Pop-a-Dots for 1, 2 or 3 objects, per page.

2. Next, there are 5 pages of upper case letters of the alphabet. Each letter has the head of an animal beginning with that letter and a Pop-a-Dot. There is a “Can you find” word list of the animals at the bottom of each page.

3. The final page is an alphabet grid. Each block of the grid shows both the upper and lower case letter as well as an object. The full upper case alphabet and lower case alphabet run across the top and bottom of the page, respectively.

I give 5 stars for the font, punctuation and correct relative sizing of upper and lower case used throughout the book. Excellent!

There are some challenges for the intended age group, in my opinion, that I would like to share.

Potential Challenges (imho):
1. When this arrived, the first thing that struck me is the weight of this book. It is too heavy for me to hold while reading alone or with a toddler. Book is recommended for ages 3-6 yrs. and those little ones could not hold this book. The only comfortable way to read it is opened flat on a table or the floor.

2. The structure of the binding prevents the pages from laying flat when the book is open on a table. The binding will be damaged/tear if a child presses down on the book trying to make the pages lay flat, specifically the pages in the middle of the book. You can see in my pics the stress creases already showing at the inner binding edge of the first and last pages just from me flipping thru the pages for 15 minutes, or so.

3. I am on the fence about the artwork (perhaps just a personal aesthetic) and choice of some items used to represent the letters. For example, I had no idea what a Xolo was. I had to google it to find out it is a rare breed of hairless dog. I dont find the artwork for Quail, Iguana, Vulture, Ice or Gorilla to be easily recognizable to a child. Yoyo, Nail, Wig are not common objects for this age group. ( I checked the copyright date to ensure this was not an older book where a yoyo would be a known object. Copyright is 2019)

All in all, the Pop-a-Dots are THE selling feature of this book. Kids love to pop them and the sound they make. If you are looking for a novel gift, this would be a great choice. As far as a learning tool, this would not be among my top choices.

I hope the pics below will clarify my thoughts on this book. Thanks!

title: Perfect size for toddlers
text:
In writing this review, I am keeping in mind this toy is designed specifically for toddlers learning the concept of action/reaction. My 2 yr old grand daughter was my 'assistant' tester and we had lots of fun with this.
PROS:
1. Size is terrific for toddler hands. The car measures 5" wide X 6.5" long and 3.5" from the floor to the top of the bubble dome. The remote control, not including the antenna, measures 3" wide X 3.5" long. The big round control button measures 3.25" across. The antennas on both the car and remote are 6.5" tall.
2.Antennas: Both of the coil spring antennas are completely enclosed in clear, flexible tubing. No worries about little fingers getting pinched. The plastic "receiver" bobble at the top of each antenna is securely attached. I was unable to pull them off so no worries about small piece choking hazard. Also, I was unable to detach either antenna.
3. The bubble dome on top of the car is large and clear, giving a nice view of the circuit board, gears and lights from all angles. The plastic dome is securely attached and appears to be quite durable. It would take a good pounding with a wooden toy hammer to crack it.
4. Both the car and the remote are made from a very strong plastic and all edges are curved. No sharp edges at any point on either piece. The colors are rich and interesting: deep shades of red, cream, olive green, lime green and yellow.
5.Batteries: The care takes 4 AA batteries. It comes with batteries already installed in the car, but be aware the instruction state these are demo batteries only to display the flashing lights and should be replaced. The remote requires a 9 volt battery, not included. My first thought was, why is this not rechargeable USB? But then, when seeing how long my 2 yr old 'assistant' will play with this I realized it would more than likely run out of the charge before she was ready to move on. So, you may want to consider rechargeable batteries.
6. Installing batteries: Each of the battery covers are held in place with one tiny Phillips head screw. I was delighted to see the tiny screws have plastic disks on their tips which prevent them from falling out of the hole while unscrewing. GREAT IDEA!!! I always drop those little suckers.
The cover of the remote slides out of the end. It is a 'drop in' design battery compartment, nothing to attach. There is a little lip at the end - you know the battery is properly installed when the end of the battery engages with the lip. Please note the markings for the positive (+) and negative (-) poles are slightly raised and found on the inside, bottom of the battery compartment. For me, they are very difficult to find and see - I had to get a flashlight to make them out. Minor issue.
7. The on/off switch is on the bottom of the car and is a good size. My 2 yr old 'assistant' can toggle the switch by herself, no problem. Six red, blue and yellow lights inside the dome start to flash as soon as it's switched to "on".
The remote does not have an on/off switch.
8. Sound: I read another review commenting on the annoying sounds. The model we received does not have any sounds other than the gears turning. No music. No honking horn. No screeching tires. I was delighted with the 'no sound' feature and the lack of sound does not diminish my 2 yr old 'assistant's enjoyment with this toy.
9. Remote: The design of the remote is great for little hands. One Big Button. This is a 'floating' button design that can be pushed down at any point on the button - center or any point around the edge of the button. As an adult, I was trying to make the care go forward/back/left/right per the position I pressed on the button. Wrong! This remote will trigger two directions, only: forward and left. The button is a toggle. Push is once and it triggers forward. Push it again and it triggers left. Push it again and it triggers forward...... and so on. Push and hold the button and the car will spin.
10: Two yr old test drive: She was delighted when she switched it on and the lights started flashing. She likes to carry it by the antenna, so I am really appreciative it is encased in that clear, flexible tubing. She had fun pushing the car around on the floor and watching the lights. When I gave her the remote, I simple said it had a button you can push. She loved it??? At first she was holding the button down and watching it spin and spin. After a while she unintentionally gave the button a simple short push and it turned left and stopped. She was surprised. From that point, sometimes it would move forward, somtimes left and of course there was the spinning. She has not yet associated the movement with how she is pressing the button, but she is having a great time. She laughs and squeals and loves to 'go get it' when it goes forward. I loved watching her and know she will have it figured out in no time.
What a great little sturdy toy to introduce toddlers to a controller.

CONS:
I really dont have any true cons. I would make 2 suggestions:
1. Place the positive (+) and negative (-) makings for the 9 volt battery on the outside of the battery compartment or make them a contrasting color to the cream.
2. In the instruction pamphlet, add a little section altering parents the remote button is a forward/left toggle only and is not intended to have forward/back/left/right functionality. This will ensure the parent does not think it is broken.

Overall, I give this toddler toy 5 stars. Well thought out design. Perfect size for toddlers. Easy to use. Durable and really cute. My 2 yr old grand daughter is having so much fun playing with this, I could not be happier.

title: Toddlers love it

The little aquatic creatures are bright, easily identifiable, float and the perfect size for little hands. The net is large enough to hold all the creatures and the material is strong. The mouths dont move but you can easily move the heads in time with the music while singing the song. They colors and details are aforable. They even have tails 🤗
This is a really nice set of puppets at an amazingly low price. Great buy!

title: Exceptional quality and value
text:
14 mo old grand daughter has so much fun playing with this. First off, it is deceptively light weight and the handle makes it easy to carry. She loves opening and closing the barn doors and the 3 swing-open stall doors, putting the animals and farmer in and out. The two levels and various openings make this a lot of fun for her. We also play together - its so light weight I can hold it open on my lap with the doors facing her and play a peek-a-boo game with the figures, which she loves. We already have a bunch of FP Little People animals and they are the perfect size for this barn. This is the toy that holds her attention and imagination the longest at this age. When playtime is over, all the animals can be stored inside, close up the barn and put it away.
Exceptional quality and value. In my opinion, this beats FP, M&Doug and Vtech barns, hands down.

This is a perfect 1st baby doll for an 11 month old - and it matches her skin tone, eye color, hair color and even has an aforable chubby baby belly. I love that the entire doll is soft (no plactic head). The attention to detail is wonderful: ears, belly button, 10 fingers, 10 toes. The soft magnetic pacifier is a clever accessory. I was tickled to discover she even has a little diaper under her bloomers. I am truly delighted with this purchase.

If you are looking for a light brown skin tone doll with dark eyes and hair, this ‘peach' Baby Stella doll is wonderful.

title: Great
text: Super fast shipping. Got on lightning deal! Awesome

title: These will soak your target...
text: But, they will also soak anything you place them on. Like every other squirt gun I've owned, these also leak. Bummer.

title: Beautiful smartwatch, app is huge disappointment
text:
I've been on the search for a smartwatch that meets all my needs. I'd like to find one that has a small watch face, bands that can be changed, uses a good app, and can monitor O2, sleep, and a wide variety of exercise. This watch was a perfect 10 in looking nice for my small wrists, and bands that can be changed. Unfortunately it fell quite short of the mark for everything else I needed.

The app has me ready to put this watch back in the box and try something else. It's a really clunky app compared to others I've tried (Fitbit, Da Fit). The exercise feature is very limiting and doesn't account for any indoor exercise like a stationary bike, aerobics, treadmill, etc. Most of the time the steps on the app are wrong compared to the steps on the watch, even after trying to sync it again. It's disappointing that there's so few watch faces to choose from. I can't even choose the screen analog look watch face that is displayed on the box, it's not an option on the app at all. The O2 feature is nice, and so is the sleep feature. I do hope they'll continue to work on the app, it does have potential but doesn't work well for me as it is right now.

I'm also having some trouble trying to use the long press on the watch itself to select features. It's just not working no matter how often I try. It's really disappointing that such a beautiful watch has so many problems. I would have really liked to use it as my main watch, but my search will have to continue on.

title: Super cute fairy house, fun to make
text:
This kit is so adorable. It came with all the parts, and a nice picture instruction booklet, very easy to understand. The only thing I would recommend is to use your own tools, rather than the ones that come with the kit. The little craft knife is very wobbly, the blade bends in the housing when trying to cut something. There are much better craft knives available that aren't very expensive so I'd recommend using that instead with a self-healing mat. Same for the little scissors, use your own instead. Good tools make the assembly process so much more enjoyable.

The kit assembly went well, no pieces were missing. It's a beautiful little kit and I look forward to trying other kits. This would be a great gift for the crafty types who enjoy miniatures, teens and older.

title: Rainy Day Fun!
text: We've used the Klutz brand craft kits before, and like how the kits have most everything we need and good instructions. I recommend this kit for the older kids, probably 9 and up. The kitties turn out really cute, and they're a lot of fun to make. The glue included is fine, but since I keep a bottle of tacky glue on hand (we do crafts a lot), we used that instead. My kids gave this project two thumbs up!

title: So much fun!
text: The quadcopter has been quite a hit with our family. We have a couple other drones and a helicopter, but since they are all smaller they're a little more difficult to operate successfully. The common opinion from everyone in my family is the size and the sturdiness of the National Geographic Quadcopter Drone lends to more successful flights. The flip feature is quite fun too. It's also nice that we don't have to register this model with the FAA.

title: Great scissors!
text: I have become quite a fan of the non-stick scissors. I have another pair of the regular Westcott non-stick scissors and have been so impressed with them that I was eager to try out this pair too. They are our go-to scissors. I love how they glide through most materials, they clean up easily and don't get gunky. The soft handles are so comfortable.

title: Cute, but more like Life Junior than Life
text:
This is much more like other versions of Life Junior my family & I have played in the past. So one big suggestion I would make would be to change the box graphics to indicate that this is the Despicable Me version of Life Junior, not the regular Life game. If you want a themed version of the actual Life game, I'd recommend the Haunted Mansion Life game.

If you don't have time to play the typical long version of Life, it's a fun and quick game. I'd recommend it for the 6-14 crowd. My daughters are older, but they love everything Minion and thought the game was pretty cute.

title: Adorable with lots of playing time
text:
This playset is adorable & definitely playable. If you have a Littlest Pet Shop fan in the family, he or she will love it. My younger daughters are in their early teens now, but have been collecting & playing with Littlest Pet Shop for around 7 years now. They really like this set and are interested in collecting the other Style Set rooms. I like how the Style Sets stack so that they're playable but don't take up as much room. My daughters love to play the LPS app on their Kindles so getting more animals to add is a huge plus for them. Their previous LPS toys coordinate nicely with this set too. What I like is that it can all be stored away in a labeled plastic bin with a lid (I use a clear medium sized Rubbermaid bin), so nothing gets lost.

The one detractor of this set in my eyes, is that it's a little overpriced. Unfortunately most of the LPS toys tend to be overpriced when first released. I usually wait until they go on sale.

title: Great fun for family game night!
text: I have three daughters, ages 19, 15, & 13. We have had a blast playing Loaded Questions. Like another reviewer mentioned, some of the questions are kind of boring, but others result in all of us roaring with laughter. It's a great stress-buster for our family, we really enjoy playing Loaded Questions when we feel like we need a break from the world.

title: Challenging and highly detailed
text: My family & I have had a lot of fun putting the ship together. We were surprised that it's not a Lego product. It's incredibly well made and very detailed. We did have some small issues with a few of the pieces not staying clicked together, perhaps it's a design flaw like the other reviewer mentioned? But overall, it made for some entertaining hours. It's a great alternative for our "puzzle night," though keep in mind, it's not a one evening project. It took us a couple weeks to finish it.

title: She's groovy!
text: What a fun doll to add to my collection! She's super cute and her outfits are so pretty, brings back many memories of the 70's. I remember seeing Becky in the fashion booklet back then and wondering why Mattel didn't produce and sell her. I'm so glad they finally brought her out for collectors, she's gorgeous.

title: She's gorgeous, but I do have a couple small complaints
text:
The box art is lovely, and I like how it has the clear inner lid for those who like to display their dolls in the box. However, I like to remove mine from the box. Perhaps a big no-no for a collector but I buy them to enjoy them, not for an investment, and this is the way I like them. Different strokes, you know?

I love the color on this Twist n Turn Barbie. She's beautiful, and her outfit is gorgeous too. But the factory did a terrible job with the back of her hair. It's rather ragged and uneven. The hair on My Favorite 1967 Twist n Turn Barbie is much more even. Thankfully it was not too difficult to fix it and she's hanging out in my display cabinet with her titian repro pal in the Zokko! outfit. I really wish Mattel would also lay off the stuff they use to shellac the Barbies' hair. It doesn't look nice at all. They need to rethink the style of stand as well. It doesn't really work to hold up the doll, unless you unsnap her dress in the back. I'll probably pick up different stands.

But otherwise I'm having so much fun gathering up some old favorites! I'll definitely be looking for the other Gold Box reproductions.

title: Way better than stock!!
text: Get these before you do much bashin and a wear out the rod ends. These hold up much better and tighten up steering and what not.

title: So far so good, great design and functionality
text:
Great upgrade for big rock especially if you go to the 6S shocks. The increase travel on the stock drive shafts due to the springs continue to break them at 100% Throttle and turning. Will change the five stars once I've ran some packs. Would recommend. Waiting on the front now

Update 9/30 One broke at the threads snapped right of. Not over torqued loose cause I'd would bind the wheel hub but used thread lock. 75 % throttle on grass, seen wheel fly off. I have noticed that the other side is bent at the threads and causes a wobble real bad at high speed. Waiting on replacements from GPM. And will update at that time. So far my recommendation is 50-50 out of the Aarmas and the offbrands on Amazon and eBay these look like they could and should be the best option but again material and craftsmanship it's about a one 3/10. Will update again once I receive the replacement or repair items.

title: Upgrade for Big Rock
text: Used for bad stock one. Had to shave steering horn to fit in servo area. No servo saver. Steering is very responsive and strong. Have only used on 2 batt pack so far so good. Have attached to GPM steering for increased reliability and performance

The betta is very soft. I keep it on my bed. One pleasant suprise I had with this plushie is that there is a small loop in front of its dorsal fin. You can kind of see it in the picture. You can hang it up by a string if you choose. This makes a great gift!

title: It's all modern Sw&Sh boosters
text:
I bought 10 of these 3 booster pack sets based on the pictures assuming that I would get a bunch of different boosters but I ended up getting 20 Astral Radiance and 10 Chilling Reign.

Technically the buyer is indeed providing exactly what the listing says but I wish they wouldn't use pics of old boosters because it gives a false impression that it's possible to get non Sw/Sh boosters when in reality it's not.

Now that I am aware of that I can just go on EBay and pay $2.50 per booster and save $5.

Bummer. This could have been really cool if it was what I thought it was based on the pictures.

title: Great cards! These are NOT resealed!
text:
I bought these because the Elite Trainer Boxes (ETB) comes with a lot of extra stuff I don't need. I hate throwing it away. I do like the cards and wanted to open a few boosters.

I got Charizard (a $60 card!) in my 2nd opened booster!

I can say for sure these packs are not resealed. They are likely pulled straight out of ETBs and resold considering booster boxes and individual packs of Celebrations were never sold like most sets.

Yes you will pay a premium but it's only natural because of how these packs are attained out of ETBs but you are getting fresh packs that have not been cherry-picked, weighed or resealed.

If they have I never would've gotten the most valuable card in the entire Celebrations set.

Here is a photo for proof.
